Wisdom hath builded her house, she hath hewn out her seven pillars:
She hath killed her beasts; she hath mingled her wine; she hath also furnished her table.<RF>her beasts: Heb. her killing<Rf>
She hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest places of the city,
Whoso <FI>is<Fi> simple, let him turn in hither: <FI>as for<Fi> him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
Come, eat of my bread, and drink of the wine <FI>which<Fi> I have mingled.
Forsake the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.
He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that rebuketh a wicked <FI>man getteth<Fi> himself a blot.
Reprove not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuke a wise man, and he will love thee.
Give <FI>instruction<Fi> to a wise <FI>man<Fi>, and he will be yet wiser: teach a just <FI>man<Fi>, and he will increase in learning.
The fear of the LORD <FI>is<Fi> the beginning of wisdom: and the knowledge of the holy <FI>is<Fi> understanding.
For by me thy days shall be multiplied, and the years of thy life shall be increased.
If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but <FI>if<Fi> thou scornest, thou alone shalt bear <FI>it<Fi>.<CM>
A foolish woman <FI>is<Fi> clamorous: <FI>she is<Fi> simple, and knoweth nothing.
For she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high places of the city,
To call passengers who go right on their ways:
Whoso <FI>is<Fi> simple, let him turn in hither: and <FI>as for<Fi> him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him,
Stolen waters are sweet, and bread <FI>eaten<Fi> in secret is pleasant.<RF>eatenâ€¦: Heb. of secrecies<Rf>
But he knoweth not that the dead <FI>are<Fi> there; <FI>and that<Fi> her guests <FI>are<Fi> in the depths of hell.<CM>
